intro: Toona sureni var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy toona, is a deciduous tree native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and alternate, ovate leaves with hairy undersides. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody, three-lobed capsules containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. The species is valued for its timber and has traditional uses in local medicine.
